articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Favorita TSSI APP  A time series analysis and clustering App
articles.contents:
Welcome to our Visual Analytics group project website for group 7
consisting of Ting Yen-Hsin, He Qiyun and Ng Jianyuan Caine

articles.title: Favorita TSSI - A Time series sales insight App
articles.description: Enabling analysis and grouping of time series data.
articles.contents:
Hi, welcome to our group project website for visual analytics. Our
group consist of Ting Yen-Hsin, He Qiyun and Ng Jianyuan Caine.
This project is about building a visual analytics app to enable a
chain of department stores to analyse and perform clustering with time
series data.
Abstract
Data for transactions at convenience stores or eCommerce websites are
freely available online for students and analysts to practice their
skills to derive insights. A common approach would be to use
unsupervised learning techniques such as k-means clustering or
hierarchical clustering to group data together before further analyzing
the groups for the unique traits. However, possibility due to complexity
or requirement for specialized enterprise software clustering of time
series data is seldom done.
The availability of R package dtwclust has allowed access to perform
time series clustering without significant cost. However, does require
some familiarity with R code to access functions in the packages.
In this project we wish to demonstrate how a customized R Shiny
application would allow users without deep technical capabilities to
perform analysis on their time series data and to group different
attributes along their time series data before further analysis into
their group characteristics.
The data set chosen for this project consist of time series data from
series of Favorita department stores located in Ecuador found here.
The focus of this project will be to develop an interactive visual
analysis app that would allow the manager of the chain department stores
to perform a time series analysis on store sales and group attributes
based on time series patterns before further inspecting the data along
generated groups.
Using appropriate time series visualizations such as horizon plots
users could compare difference and observe seasonal trends. Clustering
could then be performed along different categorical variables. Results
are then return in relevant graphs for results inspection. Based on
groups appropriate dashboard is generated for users to deep dive into
the data.
